Key Match Events: Minnesota outscored Chicago 45-24 in the fourth quarter to win for the third time in four games.
A 12-0 run over 2:43 put Minnesota up 113-106 midway through the fourth.
Edwards contributed six points during the surge.
Chicago had 30 assists on 47 field goals.
Post-Match Reflections: The Timberwolves stopped a three-game series losing streak vs. the Bulls and a five-game skid at the United Center.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Zach LaVine, who leads the Bulls in scoring this season, missed his third consecutive game with a right adductor strain.
The Timberwolves improved their ball control significantly to conclude a back-to-back set.
Others: Rudy Gobert had 21 points and nine rebounds for Minnesota.
Jaden McDaniels scored 19 points, Mike Conley had 14 points and 11 assists, and Donte DiVincenzo added 13 points for Minnesota.
